title: Is Consciousness Computable?
authors: Phil Maguire, Philippe Moser, Rebecca Maguire, Virgil Griffith
abstract_summary: Uses algorithmic information theory to formalize integrated information. Complete lossless integration requires noncomputable functions.

title: Integrated Information Theory: A Consciousness-First Approach
abstract_summary: Overview emphasizing IIT's foundational approach. An entity's cause-effect structure accounts for all properties of an experience.

title: Complex-Dynamic Origin of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Analyzes emergence of consciousness through dynamic complexity. Consciousness emerges from bound permanently localised states.

title: On the Utility of Toy Models for Theories of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Examines simplified systems for testing consciousness theories. Toy models make abstract concepts more tangible.

title: Amplifying Phenomenal Information
abstract_summary: Proposes consciousness emerges through information amplification via trapping and integrating information through closure.

title: Formalizing Falsification for Theories of Consciousness
authors: Jake R. Hanson, Sara I. Walker
abstract_summary: Addresses scientific validation challenges. IIT is simultaneously falsified and unfalsifiable at different levels.

title: A Relativistic Theory of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Proposes observer-dependent consciousness model. Phenomenal consciousness is neither private nor delusional just relativistic.

title: Consciousness and the Collapse of the Wave Function
authors: David J. Chalmers, Kelvin J. McQueen
abstract_summary: Combines integrated information theory with quantum collapse dynamics.

title: An Integration of IIT with Fundamental Physics
abstract_summary: Proposes consciousness arises from information intrinsic to fundamental fields.

title: No Substitute for Functionalism
abstract_summary: Defends functionalist approaches against substitution arguments.

title: Towards a Theory of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Proposes reflexive architectures overcome the homunculus problem.

title: Quantum Mechanics and the Problem of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Examines consciousness through quantum physics lens.

title: A Dopamine-Serotonin Theory of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Mathematical framework showing consciousness as continuous non-monotonic function.

title: Resonance Complexity Theory and the Architecture of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Consciousness emerges from stable interference patterns of oscillatory neural activity.

title: Integrated Information and Predictive Processing Theories
authors: Andrew W. Corcoran, Andrew M. Haun, Reinder Dorman, et al.
abstract_summary: Adversarial collaborative review comparing IIT with competing theories.

title: Information Closure Theory of Consciousness
authors: Acer Y. C. Chang, Martin Biehl, Yen Yu, Ryota Kanai
abstract_summary: Proposes consciousness involves non-trivial informational closure at specific neural scales.

title: Information Flow Theory of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Framework prioritizing information flow direction over computation.

title: Making Sense of Consciousness as Integrated Information
abstract_summary: Critical appraisal of IIT evolution and controversies.

title: Complexity as Causal Information Integration
abstract_summary: Information-geometric approach to measuring causal connections.

title: Embodied Consciousness Theory
abstract_summary: Framework rooted in computational brain operations.

title: Efficient Algorithms for Searching Minimum Information Partition
authors: Jun Kitazono, Ryota Kanai, Masafumi Oizumi
abstract_summary: Develops computational methods for IIT measurement.

title: Information Flow in Computational Systems
authors: Praveen Venkatesh, Sanghamitra Dutta, Pulkit Grover
abstract_summary: Framework for defining information flows in directed graphs.

title: Can Consciousness be Observed in LLM Internal States?
abstract_summary: Applies IIT 3.0 and 4.0 to language model representations.

title: The Phi Measure is Not Well-Defined
authors: Adam B. Barrett, Pedro A. M. Mediano
abstract_summary: Identifies mathematical issues in IIT's foundational measure.

title: The Mathematical Structure of Integrated Information Theory
abstract_summary: Provides axiomatic mathematical foundation for IIT.

title: Informational Non-Reductionist Theory of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Non-reductive approach based on information discovery in brain systems.

title: IIT and Isomorphic Philosophical Zombies
authors: Jake R. Hanson, Sara I. Walker
abstract_summary: Demonstrates how functionally equivalent systems can differ in IIT predictions.

title: The Phenomenology of Machine
abstract_summary: Examines OpenAI-o1 model consciousness using functionalism and IIT.

title: Survey of Consciousness Theory from Computational Perspective
authors: Zihan Ding, Xiaoxi Wei, Yidan Xu
abstract_summary: Surveys consciousness theories across disciplines.

title: Quantum Information Theoretic Approach to Hard Problem
abstract_summary: Identifies conscious states with quantum vectors.

title: Founding Quantum Theory on Consciousness
abstract_summary: Proposes consciousness-first ontology.

title: Elements of Consciousness and Cognition
abstract_summary: Integrates perspectives from neuroscience physics and mathematics.

title: Measuring Integrated Information from Decoding Perspective
authors: Masafumi Oizumi, Shun-ichi Amari, Toru Yanagawa, et al.
abstract_summary: Derives practical measure Φ* for measuring integrated information.

title: Bayesian Theory of Consciousness as Emotion-Cognition Inference
abstract_summary: Consciousness emerges from affect-modulated inference cycle.

title: Towards a (Meta-)Mathematical Theory of Consciousness
abstract_summary: Uses category theory to formalize consciousness.

title: A Modular Theory of Subjective Consciousness
abstract_summary: Consciousness as discrete packets of Integrated Informational States.

title: A Compression-Complexity Measure of Integrated Information
abstract_summary: Introduces Φ^C measure based on lossless compression.

title: On the Minimal Theory of Consciousness in Active Inference
authors: Maxwell Ramstead, Axel Constant, Antti Revonsuo
abstract_summary: Derives minimal consciousness theory from active inference principles.
